findings.description: SKILL.md Common Options table documents '--force / -f' as 'Skip confirmation', but the actual CLI uses '--yes / -y' instead. The -f flag does not exist in any bulk command.
findings.cli_reference: Confirmed in all 5 bulk command help outputs
findings.recommendation: Update the Common Options table (line 78) to replace '--force / -f' with '--yes / -y'. This is used consistently across all commands.

findings.description: The --output/-o option is implemented on all 5 bulk commands but is NOT documented in SKILL.md. This option accepts 'text' or 'json' format.
findings.cli_reference: Present in all 5 bulk commands: transition, assign, set-priority, clone, delete
findings.recommendation: Add to Common Options table: '| --output / -o | Output format (text/json) | JSON for scripting |'

findings.description: SKILL.md has a 'Transition-Only Options' section (lines 82-89) that documents --comment and --resolution, but both these options ARE documented. However, the section structure is confusingâ€”these options appear in both the main table AND as 'transition-only options', creating redundancy.
findings.recommendation: Reorganize documentation: either move transition-specific options out of the Common Options section, or clearly label which options apply to which commands using a matrix or per-command section.

findings.description: Example on line 100 uses quoted status name: --to "Done" but line 51 example uses unquoted: --to "Done". Both work but inconsistent style. Example on line 100 should be: --to Done (no quotes required)
findings.documented: jira-as bulk transition --jql "project=PROJ AND status='In Progress'" --to "Done"
findings.cli_reference: Tests show both work, but CLI help shows unquoted: --to Done
findings.recommendation: Standardize examples to use unquoted status names: --to Done, --to "In Progress" (only quote if contains spaces).

findings.description: The --no-subtasks option is documented but the semantics are unclear. The documentation (line 151) says 'Keep subtasks when deleting parent issues' but the actual CLI help says 'Do NOT delete subtasks'. This creates confusion about what 'subtasks deleted by default' means.
findings.cli_reference: Line 1243 in bulk_cmds.py confirms this is correct behavior
findings.recommendation: Clarify example line 151 comment: 'Subtasks are deleted by default; --no-subtasks prevents subtask deletion'

findings.description: SKILL.md does not explicitly document the top-level 'jira-as bulk' command syntax or explain that it requires a subcommand. The Available Commands table shows subcommands but not the command group itself.
findings.documented: Not explicitly shown as parent command
findings.recommendation: Add to Quick Start section: 'All bulk operations use the format: jira-as bulk <command> [options]'

findings.location: SKILL.md lines 82-89 (Transition-Only Options) and lines 158-175 (Parameter Tuning Guide)
findings.description: SKILL.md mentions advanced tuning options like 'batch-size', 'enable-checkpoint', 'resume', and 'list-checkpoints' in Parameter Tuning Guide (no longer visible in provided SKILL.md excerpt, but referenced in old findings), but these options do NOT exist in the actual CLI implementation.
findings.cli_reference: Confirmed by checking bulk_cmds.py implementation - only standard options exist
findings.recommendation: Remove any references to advanced tuning options from SKILL.md. The CLI does not support checkpointing or batch-size tuning. Recommend using --max-issues for batching instead.

findings.description: The bulk clone examples (lines 129-134) do not prominently feature --dry-run usage despite clone being marked as high-risk ('!' level - creates many issues). Contrast with bulk delete examples which properly show --dry-run first. Clone documentation should follow same safety pattern.
findings.documented: Mentioned in text but not in clear before/after example
findings.recommendation: Restructure bulk clone examples to show --dry-run demonstration first: 'jira-as bulk clone --jql "sprint='Sprint 42'" --include-subtasks --dry-run' followed by 'After reviewing the preview, execute without --dry-run'

validation_results.cli_version: jira-as with bulk_cmds.py from jira-as package

items: Fix BULK-001: Replace --force with --yes in Common Options table
Fix BULK-002: Document --output/-o option on all commands
Fix BULK-007: Remove references to non-existent advanced tuning options
Fix BULK-003: Reorganize transition-specific options documentation
Fix BULK-004: Standardize example formatting for quoted vs unquoted values
Fix BULK-008: Add --dry-run demonstration for clone operation
Fix BULK-006: Document bulk command group syntax explicitly
